required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase II Clinical Trial of Vitamin D3 for Reducing Recurrence of Recurrent Lower Urinary Tract Infections
clinical_study.official_title: Phase II Clinical Trial of Vitamin D3 for Reducing Recurrence of Recurrent Lower Urinary Tract Infections: a Multicenter, Randomized, Placebo-controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study was to initially evaluate the optimal dose, efficacy, and safety of vitamin D3 for reducing recurrence of recurrent urinary tract infections (rUTIs).

detailed_description.textblock:
Urinary tract infection (UTI) is a multiple disease that ranks second only to respiratory infections in infectious diseases and is one of the most common infectious diseases among adults. After the first urinary tract infection, the probability of recurrence within half a year and within one year was as high as 24% and 70%, respectively. Urinary tract infection itself has the characteristics of easy recurrence, which is closely related to the abuse of antibiotics, the generation of bacterial resistance, and the decline of local immune function of mucosa.
In the urinary tract, the antibacterial peptide Cathelicidin is mainly located in the proximal tubules of the kidney and the epithelial cells of the renal pelvis and ureter. LL37 is the only antibacterial peptide present in the human body of the Cathelicidin family, which can be regarded as a natural antibiotic produced by the body. Antibacterial peptides have a broad-spectrum antibacterial effect and can exert antibacterial effects against both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria. Vitamin D intake increases the activity of endogenous antimicrobial peptides. Preclinical cell test of Zensun Sci. & Tech. Co., Ltd. confirmed the induction of LL37 in urethral epithelial cells by vitamin D and its broad-spectrum antibacterial effect. Animal experiments also showed the therapeutic effect of LL37 on UTI.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A multicenter, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: To ensure that the randomized drug treatment period is double-blind, the study drug and placebo control have the same appearance, smell, and taste. Furthermore, the package and label are also adjusted correspondingly to ensure blindness.

primary_outcome.description: UTI episodes during 48-week treatment for each subject

secondary_outcome.measure: Recurrence rate of UTI in 48 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Comparing the recurrence rate of UTI between different treatment groups
Comparing the number of days from the beginning of the study to the first recurrence of UTI, and the number of days from each recurrence to the next recurrence between different treatment groups.
Ratio of the cumulative duration of UTI-free period to treatment duration

other_outcome.measure: Antibiotic treatment during the recurrence of UTI
other_outcome.description: Subjects will be given antibiotics during the recurrence of UTI, type/name and the duration of antibiotic treatment will be compared between different treatment groups.

other_outcome.measure: Symptom score of each episode of recurrent lower urinary tract infection
other_outcome.description: Symptom score of each episode of UTI will be evaluated using an overall impression scale with 7 severity levels ( "a" means the best outcome and "g" as the worst outcome.)
Urinary culture bacterial count at each recurrence of UTI

other_outcome.measure: Blood and urine levels of antimicrobial peptides
other_outcome.description: Blood and urine levels of antimicrobial peptides at planned and additional visits

arm_group.description: 4000IU Vitamin D3 Oral Tablet plus standard antibiotic therapy
2000IU Vitamin D3 Oral Tablet plus standard antibiotic therapy
Placebo Oral Tablet plus standard antibiotic therapy

intervention.description: Oral administration, 2 tablet per time, qd, oral administration with the first meal, continuous use for 48 weeks
Oral administration, 1 tablet of each per time, qd, oral administration with the first meal, continuous use for 48 weeks
Oral administration, 2 tablet per time, qd, oral administration with the first meal, continuous use for 48 weeks

facility.name: The First Affiliated Hospital of Xi 'an Jiaotong University
